title: Rhode Island man finds exotic lizard while shoveling driveway
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Off Beat Exactly how the reptile ended up in Providence remains a mystery.
A Providence man found an exotic tegu lizard while shoveling his driveway this week.

New England Wildlife Center By Abby Patkin January 29, 2026 | 1:04 PM 1 minute to read Shoveling a New England driveway rarely yields more than a soggy newspaper or half-dead patch of grass, but a Rhode Island man made the find of a lifetime this week when he unearthed an exotic lizard.

title: Report: Pro Football Hall of Fame confirms that Bill Polian voted for Bill Belichick
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The former Colts GM was accused of telling voters they should wait a year to induct Belichick.
Bill Polian AP Photo/Gene J.
Puskar, Former Colts GM Bill Polian made headlines with his comments about not being exactly sure whether or not he voted for Bill Belichick to make the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: ICE detains owner of Stow restaurant
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The owner of Stow Cafe, a Brazilian immigrant, was arrested by ICE Wednesday morning.
The owner of a cafe in Stow was detained by ICE officers Wednesday morning, according to local police and lawmakers.
Max Fernandes, the owner of Stow Cafe on Great Road, was the person detained.

title: Beloved Cape Cod Potato Chips factory to close in Hyannis
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Campbell’s announced Thursday it will shut down the plant and shift production to more efficient facilities.

Handout, courtesy of Campbell's By Beth Treffeisen updated on January 29, 2026 | 12:58 PM 2 minutes to read For generations of Cape visitors, a rainy day wasn’t complete without a stop at the Cape Cod Potato Chips factory in Hyannis, where families could press against plexiglass windows to watch their favorite chips tumble down the production line before receiving a free bag at the end.
That tradition ended during the COVID-19 pandemic, and now Campbell’s has announced that it will close the plant for good after more than 40 years in operation.
